Function Documentation

int laser_odometry_example ( int  argc,
char *  argv[] 
)

Pose estimation by matching a sequence of laser scans.

This is an example for scan matching without using odometry if you use odometry, then you'll likely get a better results. As each consecutive pair of scan is matched, the pose error will accumulate quickly.

int laser_odometry_example_improved ( int  argc,
char *  argv[] 
)

Pose estimation by matching a sequence of laser scans. Reference scan is only switched when needed.

This is an example for scan matching without using odometry if you use odometry, then you'll likely get a better results. In this function the reference scan is changed only when the match error increases or the number of matched points decreases.

char *  argv[]

int read_scan4 ( FILE *  fin,
PMScan *  ls 
)

Reads out a series of ranges in mm corresponding to a scan.

Reads Hokuyo URG-04LX-UG1 data organized in one scan per line format:
time[ms] x[cm] y[cm] th[deg] r44[mm] ... r725[mm]

Parameters:
fin The opened input file.
ls The read scan is stored here.

int read_scan5 ( FILE *  fin,
PMScan *  ls 
)

Reads out a series of ranges in m, corresponding to a scan.

Hokuyo UTM one line per scan, [m], no pose or time Reads Hokuyo UTM-30LX data organized in one scan per line format:
r0[mm] ... r1080[m]

Parameters:
fin The opened input file.
ls The read scan is stored here.
